attribution: Used with permission from Cambridge University Tripos, Physics Paper 1A, Question A4.
title: Prism

children.value: The prism (whose cross section is an isosceles triangle) shown in Figure 1 has a mass of $\valuedef{m}{0.1}{kg}$ , and you wish to lift it, touching the upper two faces only. If the coefficient of friction between the prism's surface and your skin is $\valuedef{\mu }{0.4}{}$ , how hard must you push directly against each face in order to support the prism?
